private_information: I can only pick up and move blocks whose labels are vowels: A, E, I.
I can only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can hold and move only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute moves that help transform the initial stacks into the target single stack with order A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on table.

private_information: I can only pick up and move blocks whose labels are consonants: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K.
I can only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
I can hold and move only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute moves that help transform the initial stacks into the target single stack with order A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J on K on table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their local plans into a single PDDL domain and problem suitable for a planner.
I will produce the final PDDL domain and problem targeted at the FastDownwards solver.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent contributions and produce a PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global stacking goal for the FastDownwards solver.

public_information: There are 11 uniquely labelled blocks: A B C D E F G H I J K.
Blocks are arranged initially in four stacks: Stack1 bottom-to-top H, G, A; Stack2 bottom-to-top K, F, D, B; Stack3 I alone on the table; Stack4 bottom-to-top C, E, J.
Only the top block of any stack may be picked up at any time.
Agents can manipulate only one block at a time.
The global goal is to end with a single tower with K on the table and J on K and I on J and H on I and G on H and F on G and E on F and D on E and C on D and B on C and A on B.
One agent can only manipulate vowel-labelled blocks and the other can only manipulate consonant-labelled blocks.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are an expert at local block manipulation but you are restricted to vowel-labelled blocks. Provide feasible moves you can perform from the current public initial configuration under your capabilities. Do not produce PDDL. Describe moves as an ordered list of actions in the form move(X, from, to) where X is a vowel block you can legally move given the top-of-stack constraint.
local_plan.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal} Provide a step-by-step ordered list of concrete moves you can perform immediately or after other agents move blocks, always respecting that you can only touch top blocks and only vowel-labelled blocks. If a block you need is not top, indicate which other moves by other agents would be required first.

local_plan.system_prompt: You are an expert at local block manipulation but you are restricted to consonant-labelled blocks. Provide feasible moves you can perform from the current public initial configuration under your capabilities. Do not produce PDDL. Describe moves as an ordered list of actions in the form move(X, from, to) where X is a consonant block you can legally move given the top-of-stack constraint.
local_plan.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Public information: {environment->public_information} Your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal} Provide a step-by-step ordered list of concrete moves you can perform immediately or after other agents move blocks, always respecting that you can only touch top blocks and only consonant-labelled blocks. If a block you need is not top, indicate which other moves by other agents would be required first.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL modeling. Your job is to integrate local plans and produce a single PDDL domain and a single PDDL problem targeting the FastDownwards solver. The domain must explicitly model agents constraints where helpful but keep actions unambiguous and account for the top-of-stack and single-block manipulation constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. You will receive two local plan artifacts from agents. Use the public information {environment->public_information} and the agents' private information {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} and {agents->consonant_agent->private_information} and the agents' reported local plans {local_plan_vowel} and {local_plan_consonant} to produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that achieves the global goal {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Keep actions for the two agents conceptually distinct if it helps modeling, but produce a single domain and a single problem. Do not assume additional capabilities beyond what has been declared. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
